intro: Filago heterantha, commonly known as the heterogeneous filago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and clustered in a head. Filago heterantha is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in poor nutrient conditions.
